summary: Alytus County is a designated administrative region within Lithuania, classified under the category of regions of EU Member States. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, Alytus County plays a significant role in regional governance, facilitating the implementation of EU policies at a local level. The region is involved in various EU funding programs aimed at enhancing socio-economic development and ensuring compliance with EU regulations. As an integral part of Lithuania's administrative structure, Alytus County contributes to the overall cohesion and integration objectives of the European Union, promoting sustainable development and regional cooperation among Member States.
